ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, I would recommend it because it offers a very deep knowledge on the major issues regarding the study of Boccaccio.
I would certainly recommend this class to any and all interested in vernacular literature, poetry, story-telling, Italian, medieval thought and culture etc. etc.
I would totally reccomend italian 715 to a fellow student, it was a very interesting and challenging class, and it totally changed my understanding of Boccaccio.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The class helped me to deepen my knowledge on one of the most important Italian authors and to understand what are the main issues in the scholarship today.

This course was enormously helpful and will certainly be applicable to my future work, which lies in the department of English. I hope to continue to study Italian literature throughout my graduate career, and eventually to incorporate it into my dissertation research.

I think that this course will contribute to the shaping of my further research. I believe that in this class I have begun a research project that will accompany me for the rest of my graduate years and Yale, and probably beyond that. Prof. Lummus was really helpful in helping me in my research.
